text: Hey guys, I'll be covering for OMSI in the short term
let me know if there are any immediate questions
what's the latest on the other screen at OMSI?

<@U026NB2U2> thanks for the heads-up! I'm currently on the "network activity indicator" ticket, and when I finish it I'll need input about the "Screen was completely blank" ticket before I can move that forward

<@U026NB2U2>:  - definitely biggest question(s) to track down are in line with iamewald's comment.   Mark was supposed to contacted planar about purchasing a replacement screen.  The installation has two screens and we are only running on the left screen.   the right remains offline, due to the touch sensor appears broken for top 1/3 of the screen.
But also what is Mark's eta on more mac mini's for the two screens in the Theory cafe?

The build we took over last week completed the feature that allows OMSI to choose what content appears on which screens - which was the necessary feature Mark needed before rolling it out to the two screens in the cafe.

Mark's idea of dates for deliverables seemed to always be off from what Karen would convey to spencer and myself, so it would just be really good to checkin with Mark and see what his additional rollout schedule would be.
He also talked about purchasing additional screens from planar for the Turbine Hall while he was purchasing the replacement.
Thanks, Scott. I'll reach out to Mark today to determine the status of the screens, hardware, etc.
Spencer, I'll check in on that bug once it's assigned my way - i may have some clarification questions as well.

Also <@U026NB2U2> - my loose development end is that I had been working on "lazy loading" the content, which I did FINALLY complete last week (took much longer than expected), but I still need to integrate that work with the new content chooser that spencer built...  in other words, now that we can choose what content should be displayed on the screen, we need to lazy load "that" content and not the defacto "all" content that was loading before.
I'm on vroom today - but would like to wrap that loose end up tomorrow.
cool. thanks for the update.
Update - week to ten days on the replacement screen. It needs to be retrofitted into the hardware.
Mac Minis have not been ordered.
Turbine Hall stuff is for a later date and not in the scope of this project.
(He's got plans to purchase screens for various halls, but there will be a setup fee that we'll be able to charge as part of that).
<@U0289USNA>: Do we want to be working on Mac Minis in both the lobby and the Theory bar in parallel? If so, let me know and I'll tell Mark to purchase the screens tonight.
also, if you guys can shoot me the schedule that you're working under I will confirm with Mark if that is his expectation as well.
thanks for both your consideration on this - I'll do my best to lessen the transition speedbumps.

<@U026NB2U2>: Theory already has screens, so it would be "purchase mac minis".   The timetable for that is up to mark as far as I am concerned, I don't know when he was expecting to do them, other than he was waiting on the feature to control the content which is now ready - so we are now ready if he is.

Cool. I'll have them purchase those and will confirm his expectation of when he wants them by. From my conversation with him, he was looking for us to push him on schedule. I did not get the sense he had a prevailing deadline on the Theory setup.
The only schedule I am working on was that we were supposed to be "done" on friday...   this week was to handle any bug fixes that came up and after this week we were "done-done".
that was what Karen was communicating to me, so that schedule could have been entirely her/our own internal schedule.
k. outside of Mark's interpretation of that, how close are we to hitting done-done on Friday?
I can definitely finish the network activity indicator by then. The "screen was completely blank" will probably not be done though.
cool. i'll come find you to discuss the blank issue
i've got a couple of meetings but will try to squeeze that in before 3, if not, tomorrow.
will let you know either way.
sounds good

<@U026NB2U2>: can you confirm with Mark if the replacement screen is the same legacy EP series or if he purchased a new PS series screen?  If he went PS, we will need time to test with that screen as the touch sensor is different and we don't know of how it will act with the app yet.
Also we should loop I'm <@U02HAJ6JF> on status updating as I believe there are changes he has made to the emails but those updates have not yet also been made to the landing pages
<@U02HAJ6JF|joshua> has joined the channel
hey omsi!
thanks <@U0289USNA> - i have some changes to run by <@U026NB2U2>. and yes, let me know if there are any corresponding changes to be made to the landing
Just got back online. Will take a look now.
<@U0289USNA>: are we using New Relic for OMSI?
ah, nope.
ok. any ideas where we might?
LEGO?
We dont use it on anything
k.
oh...   hmmmm....    maybe in the way back machine
I'll keep tracking it down...
the way back machine?
like <http://Archive.org|Archive.org>?
as in something from 3-5 years ago - where shawn was using Heroku
there was something way back then.
oh - no - this is more recent.
i'll follow up
thanks tho
check with evans than
will do!
